articles.description: Ten-man Manchester United throw away the lead twice as they fall to a 3-2 home defeat by Galatasaray in the Champions League.
articles.title: Galatasaray twice come from behind to stun Man Utd

articles.description: Elye Wahi starred as French side Lens came from behind to shock Arsenal in their Champions League Group B encounter.
articles.title: Wahi grabs winner as Lens upset Arsenal

articles.description: The PGMOL releases the audio recordings between the match officials for Liverpool forward Luis Diaz's disallowed goal against Tottenham.
articles.title: PGMOL make controversial Diaz VAR audio public

articles.description: Jude Bellingham scores and assists as Real Madrid battle to a 3-2 victory against Napoli at Stadio Diego Armando Maradona in the Champions League.
articles.title: Bellingham on target as Real battle to win at Napoli

articles.description: Burnley grab their first Premier League victory of the season as they win at fellow strugglers Luton Town.
articles.title: Burnley beat Luton for first league win of season

articles.description: Watch as Seattle Seahawks' Devon Witherspoon intercepts Daniel Jones' pass to score a 97-yard touchdown in a 24-3 win over the New York Giants.
articles.title: Witherspoon scores 97-yard touchdown after interception

articles.description: England interim head coach Louis Deacon says losing the World Cup final was "devastating", but they have some "great memories" as they head to New Zealand for the inaugural WXV tournament.
articles.title: Red Roses ready for WXV after 'devastating' World Cup

articles.description: Former Chelsea and Everton manager Frank Lampard is interested in replacing Michael Beale at Rangers.
articles.title: Lampard keen on discussions for Rangers job

articles.description: Ipswich Town make it eight wins out of 10 in the Championship as they return to the top of the table by beating Hull City.
articles.title: Ipswich go top of Championship with win over Hull

articles.description: Watch Max Whitlock's "sensational" return to the global stage as Great Britain finish fourth in the men's team final at the World Gymnastics Championships in Antwerp.
articles.title: 'Class act!' - Whitlock shines on Worlds return
